definitions: To move (a door, window, or lid) so as to leave an entrance or gap.
To make or become accessible or available.
To start or begin (a business, event, or discussion).
To make a hole or gap in (something).
examples: She opened the door for her guest.
The new store opened last week.
He opened the book to chapter one.
The flower opened in the morning sun.
They opened a new branch in the city.
